channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Administration Orders Work Halted on Wind Farm That Is Nearly Built
item.description: The order to stop construction on Revolution Wind off the coast of Rhode Island is part of a campaign against renewable energy.

item.title: Abrego Garcia, Free From Tennessee Jail, Is Returning to Maryland, Lawyer Says
item.description: Shortly after, the Trump administration informed his lawyers that it might re-deport Mr. Abrego Garcia to Uganda within three business days, people fa...

item.title: Justice Department Releases Ghislaine Maxwell Interview Transcripts
item.description: The transcripts and audio, covering two days of discussions between Ms. Maxwell and Todd Blanche, the Justice Department’s No. 2, are likely to raise ...

item.title: 5 Takeaways From Ghislaine Maxwell’s Interview About Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: In a courthouse interview with the deputy attorney general, Ms. Maxwell, who has been convicted of sex trafficking, maintained that President Trump an...

item.title: Nvidia Is Making a New Chip for China Amid Debate on AI Exports
item.description: Jensen Huang, Nvidia’s chief executive, said he plans to ask the Trump administration’s permission to sell a more powerful chip to Chinese companies.

item.title: Trump Begins Buildup of U.S. Naval Forces Outside Venezuela, but Many Remain Skeptical
item.description: President Nicolás Maduro said Venezuela would not back down while facing a U.S. naval buildup. But many in the country doubt a confrontation will come...

item.title: Trump says Intel agreed to give the government 10% of the chipmaker. ‘We do a lot of deals like that. I’ll do more of them’
item.description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick previously said the U.S. government should receive equity in return for the CHIPS Act cash grants Intel has received...

item.title: Cracker Barrel’s first rebrand in nearly 50 years backfired. The company’s stock lost nearly $100 million after introducing a more minimalist look
item.description: The restaurant chain has gotten heat, accused of going too woke.

item.title: Sam Altman says colleagues are glad he’s a dad now, because they think raising a child will help him make ‘better decisions for humanity’
item.description: The OpenAI CEO and his husband, Oliver Mulherin, welcomed a baby boy in February.

item.title: Ethereum brushes record high after Fed chair says ‘balance of risks’ is shifting
item.description: Investors interpreted Jerome Powell’s remarks as evidence for September rate cuts.

item.title: Elon Musk tried to court Mark Zuckerberg to help him finance xAI’s attempted $97 billion OpenAI takeover, court filing shows
item.description: Musk has taken up legal arms against Sam Altman’s OpenAI, not only trying to acquire it in a hostile takeover, but claim the startup breached its cont...

item.title: Thaksin Shinawatra, Former Thai Premier, Cleared of Insulting Monarchy
item.description: But the reprieve for Thaksin Shinawatra, who remains a political force, did not mean that the legal troubles for him and his family were over.

item.title: Global Monitors Confirm Famine in Part of Gaza. What Does That Mean?
item.description: A panel of food security experts said the famine could spread to more of the enclave within weeks.

item.title: ‘No Meeting Planned’ Between Putin and Zelensky, Top Russian Diplomat Says
item.description: It was the clearest sign yet that President Trump’s push for an imminent summit was faltering.

item.title: Map: 7.5-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes the South Atlantic Ocean
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
